quests.name: Botaniason Tools 2
quests.description: With some of the things we've discovered about Mana and utilizing it, I think we can easily improve on a few tools so far and start researching more things. I highly suggest making more of those Endoflame flowers, as I get the feeling we'll be using a LOT more Mana as we research more things...

tasks.longDescription: This version of the Mana Spreader will only send Mana when it has a Redstone signal.

The Thaumaturgic branch have been working alongside us, and we've worked out a way to imbue their Scribing Tools with Mana, so that they can refill it in a Mana Pool instead of with Ink Sacs, which we feel is much more Magical.

Something we've found in our studies of this new Mana is an odd thing. Well, one of the Assistants is a bit infatuated with Halloween (which is forever away, you know!) and was making some spooky things with some of the materials we've been testing here...                          Well, he took a Pumpkin that had been filled with some Bone, some Rotten Flesh, a bit of Gunpowder, and hung it from a String atop a pole made of Iron Bars, and suddenly the Mana burst it to life in the form of a floating, burning creature that spat fireballs at us!         According to the other Branches here that have been studying your data, it's apparently called a Blaze? Well, the Mana that infused it seems to make it drop a lot of Blaze Powder, instead of the reported Blaze Drops... perhaps this will be useful to you?

quests.name: Mana Infusion
quests.description: Interesting! If you hold your Living Wand, you can even see the energy flowing from the Mana Spreaders, and it seems to even control how things rotate. I have one of my assistants practicing with his wand, and I'm updating the Lexica Botania with more instructions as we speak. Since dipping a Mana Pool and Mana Petals into Mana has netted us progress, we'll just start tossing everything but the kitchen sink into this Mana Pool! We'll be sure to add more things we discover to the Lexica Botania as we find them.

tasks.longDescription: Managlass can be turned into Panes, while Manasteel can be formed into Blocks for easier storage.

Looking at all our research, we're going to be using more and more Mana in the tools we make. Plus, we don't quite look the magical part, no? I mean, we're working with Mana and stuff...                             So, enter the Manaweave Cloth. By combining Mana Infused String to create Cloth, you can then form the Cloth into various pieces of Manaweave Clothing.                         By wearing an entire set of Manaweave Clothing, all tools and devices you use that require Mana will take a good bit less! That means you can use them for much longer, and to boot you look quite fetching!      Since it might take a good bit for you to gather enough Mana and String, I'll only ask you to make the Robe Top.

quests.name: A Signal to Noise
quests.description: We've been combining various Petals and items in different ways to see what we come up with. At first, we created a pretty yet useless cube that seemed to be somewhat Unstable. We continued researching it, and by surrounding an eye Pearl from one of those really creepy Endermen in these to create a Signaling device that is moderately more useful. This gave one of my assistants a brilliant (or slightly crazy...) idea of turning that into a gun! Well, more specifically, a Signal Flare that not only acts like its name, it ALSO seems to emit some supersonic sounds we can't hear that incapacitates Monsters around you temporarily!

tasks.description: Can You Guess My Fav Color?

tasks.longDescription: You can stop the constant fireworks display by sending a Redstone Signal to this device.

Speaking of noise, one of the assistants got back from some sportsball event sporting some sort of long horn noise maker. It was loud and annoying, but it gave us an idea!                                   The Cacophonium can mimic any creature's natural sounds and play them back. Just Right Click it onto any creature, then hold Right Click to play it back.                        You can also Right Click the Cacophonium onto a Note Block to turn it into a Cacophonium Block, which you can activate like a normal Note Block.

quests.name: Teacher to Student
quests.description: Since we're dealing with Magic here, we've been in contact with some of the Magical branches of The Ferret Business. They've given us some excellent ideas on what we can do. One of them is to alter our Mana Pool into a sort of Alchemical cauldron.                                      Another would be to break down common items into their very essence and form Runes of concentrated power. We're still testing the extents of these additions to our Mana Network, and will update the Lexica Botania with our findings!

tasks.longDescription: You can convert a wide variety of things, all of which we'll list in the Lexica Botania. One of the most useful we've found is turning Rotten Flesh into Leather!
You MUST bind the Altar to your Mana Network before you can create Runes. Look at your Lexica Botania to find out how. Then make a Mana Rune to test it.

Other than the Rune of Mana, the first tier of Runes are the Elements : Fire, Water, Earth, and Air. When you create any first tier Rune, you get two of them, which is super handy!                                 To boot, when you use a Rune in the Runic Altar to make something, the Rune is not consumed. It, instead, acts as a Catalyst, and will be given back when the item is created.

There are a few magical flowers you can miniaturize with an Alchemy Catalyst. They have a shorter range than normal flowers.                When this is done with a Passive Flower like the Daybloom, it instead becomes a Motif, which is purely for decoration and will not generate Mana, nor will it Decay.

Now that we are making a lot more Mana Generating flowers, and require much more Mana, we need a good way to connect these flowers to Mana Pools. Doing it one at a time is...tedius.                                      Enter the Floral Obedience Stick. Right Clicking it onto a Mana Pool will bind all relevant flowers within range to it.

quests.name: Battle of Gaia
quests.description: The Elves have mentioned another material they use, but since its technically a living thing, they cannot send it to us. They have, however, told us how to obtain this material, called Gaia Spirits. Unfortunately, its fairly dangerous. It involves a ritual summoning of a Guardian, who you will have to slay to prove yourself worthy of obtaining the Spirits. The Elves warn me that this is VERY dangerous and will require excellent fighting skills, strong weapons, and excellent armor to survive. You will need to gather 9 blocks of strong material. Iron is the cheapest, but Gold, Emerald, and Diamonds work as well. Constructing the Ritual area is explained in your updated Lexica Botania, thanks to the Elves.

tasks.longDescription: When the Elves say it is a difficult fight, they mean it. Prepare to die often if you are ill-equipped. The Elves suggest a Terra Blade, Terrasteel Armor, and copious amounts of Brews!

quests.name: New Blossoms
quests.description: So we've been trying various combinations of regular and Mana infused Petals to see if we can come up with some new Flowers. We made a breakthrough by adding more than just Petals to the Apothecary: carefully cutting some Grass with some Shears, and then coating it with Redstone Dust gave us a controlled way to add Redstone to the Apothecary. This lead to the discovery of two even more interesting Flowers! Both 'damage' creatures, but in different ways from each other. One of the assistants has been 'testing' them with flocks of chickens. Lots of chickens. We're pretty sure he just wanted the results for his barbecue...

tasks.longDescription: This Flower will damage ALL creatures, good or bad, around it, except for you and any other Assistants you have with you.
Unlike the Bellethorne, this Flower will only kill Adult farm animals.

quests.name: Special Eyes
quests.description: The eerie Endermen of your world has been a growing interest of many laboratories in The Ferret Business. Examining their Pearl-like eyes and doing some tests, we've created various devices based on their strange, unique vision properties. Hopefully, they'll be helpful to you!

tasks.longDescription: A Japanese tradition some folks here at the Ferret Business like to do is make these little dolls and hang them up when hoping for sunny weather.                               Making them out of Manaweave Cloth imparts some magical properties to the ghostly looking dolls. When you make one and place it somewhere, any Rainstorm or Snowstorm won't last as long.             A bonus, giving the Teru Teru Bozu a Sunflower by Right Clicking the flower onto it, or throwing it at it, will bring the sun back immediately.

quests.name: Flowers of Winter
quests.description: During the Winter, everything is dark, cold, and quiet. Flowers bide their time, waiting for spring, as people huddle and wait.                     The Winter encourages those still alive to eat to keep going, while the cold causes emotions to spike high as it effects how creatures move and react.

tasks.longDescription: The Rune of Winter encompases the wet and cold lands.                     The Rune of Gluttony expands upon the need to eat as much as you can, when the cold times can offer very little.                              The Rune of Wrath expands in a different aspect, the fear of the dark and the cramped, cold months coalescing into anger to survive.         The Rune of Envy expands on the aspect of wanting that which others have in this cold time of the year.
The Tangleberrie will create a wall of force that keeps creatures inside it, but does not prevent creatures from entering the circle.
Conversely, the Jiyuulia will create a wall of force that keeps creatures out. It does not stop creatures inside the wall from walking out of it, though.
The Medumone will heavily slow down any creature (other than you and your assistants, of course!) that get near it.

The Entropinnyum is a special Flower. If you set off some TNT near it, the explosion will be absorbed and converted into a LOT of Mana.                                        The Rose Arcana, though, will consume your Experiences when you stand close to it, turning them into Mana.
The Munchdew generates Mana by consuming Leaves.

quests.name: Flowers of Summer
quests.description: In the Summer, many flowers reach their full blooms, inviting fun celebrations!                                  During the Summer, flowers and people tend to consume more as they enjoy the heat, form friendships and enjoy their time together.

tasks.longDescription: The Rune of Summer encompases the Earth and Air, with all the fun of beach Sands and treats like Melon.                                            Building on the Summer Rune, the Rune of Lust encompases the Summer heat and joy, with a bit of love and passion.                            The Rune of Pride expands upon the feelings of superiority and importance of those who survived to this bountiful time.

We're starting to require more and more Mana, so we need better Mana generating flowers. We've found one that will drink a block of water in the 3x3 area around it. If the water it drinks is in an infinite water pool (Water physics in your world is...weird...), it won't consume the block when it drinks.                Hydroangeas only consume Water on the same level of it, and seem to work better when it is raining. Like Dayblooms and Nightshades, they will die off after a few days.
The Exoflame will heat up any Furnace nearby as long as it is fed Mana.
The Narslimmus will instantly kill naturally spawning Slimes in Slime Chunks, generating Mana from them. The Slimes will not split, nor will they drop anything.
The Gourmaryllis is a very hungry plant, and will consume any edible Food in reach. Watch out, as it will overeat, but only generate Mana for the first Food item it grabs.
The Pollidisiac will ellicit a feeling of...well, something close to love, in farm creatures near it. And then Nature takes its course. Enough said.

Thermalillies are similar to Hydroangea's, except they consume Lava instead of Water. They take a long while to cool down after consuming the hot drink, but provide a lot of Mana.                      If a Thermalilly consumes Lava within five minutes of it's last meal, it's cool down timer will reset, and not give you Mana.

quests.name: Elven Flowers
quests.description: The Elves have helped expand our botanical catalogue with a few special flowers. These, generally, either create or consume a LOT of Mana compared to the other flowers we've made.

tasks.longDescription: The Orechild is a very Mana hungry Flower, but for good reason. With enough Mana, it can transform Stone around it into a random Ore!
The Loonium requires a ton of Mana to feed it, but in return, it will a random item out of thin air, usually something old and mystical that looks right at home in a Dungeon chest.
The Heisei Dream will alter a monster's vision so that instead of his own comrade, he will see his most hated enemy, and be filled with a burning rage so that he attacks them.
The Kekimuras is a bit more picky than the Gourmaryllis. It will only eat large Cakes placed around it.

This flower teleports items dropped near it to a defined point. You can define this point similar to how you Bind a Mana Spreader to a target. You can see the target of the Spectranthenam by Sneaking while holding your Wand of the Forest.

The Spectrolus generates Mana by consuming Wool...but only certain colors at certain times. It will eat ALL wool dropped near it, but it will only generate Mana for the first White Wool it eats, then it will want the next color in the spectrum. The Spectrum is : White, Orange, Magenta, Light Blue, Yellow, Lime, Pink, Gray, Light Gray, Cyan, Purple, Blue, Brown, Green, Red, Black.
The Orechild Ignem is like the normal Orechild, except it will produce Ores found in the Nether, and only in Netherrack.

Passive Flowers, such as the Daybloom and Nightshade, usually are only really good for jumpstarting ones Botaniacal adventures. They produce very little Mana in the scope of things, and don't last long.                          They are, though, not useless at all. The Rafflowsia is a special Elven flower that can consume Passive flowers to generate a decent amount of Mana. The Flowers just need to be planted close to it, and it will consume them.      The Rafflowsia will give diminishing returns if it consumes multiple of the same Passive flower in a row, so it's best to vary the flower's diet!

quests.name: Flowers of Autumn
quests.description: Autumn brings about changes, both in people's minds and in the world around you.                          Both flowers and creatures look to change and prepare for winter. Stockpiling food, making things easier, protecting themselves for the harshness of the dark, cold months coming ahead.

tasks.longDescription: The Rune of Autumn combines the warmth at the end of summer, with the airy winds of change.             The Rune of Sloth expands on the feelings of change, working in preperation towards the sedantary time of winter, slowing things down.

The Rannuncarpus will pick up items dropped near it and try to 'place' or 'plant' them on the ground. It will only place them on the same ground that the block under the block its planted on is: if the block under the dirt is Sand, it will only place the items on Sand.

The Marimorphosis will transform regular Stone near it into decorative Stone, based on the Biome its located in. You can use this stone to make slabs and stairs, and also to make alternate versions of the Petal Apothecary!

The Hopperhock will pick up any item dropped close to it, and place it into a Chest or other inventory it can reach. If the inventory has an Item Frame in it, the Hopperhock will ONLY insert items that match ones already in the inentory.
The Tigerseye seems give both the look and the presence of a very large Cat being present. If you have anything afraid of a Cat that's Creep'n around, well...
Vinculotus is a strange, eerie Flower that is quite helpful when you are facing the Endermen. It will prevent them from being able to Teleport!

quests.name: Flowers of Spring
quests.description: Spring is a time of blossoms, of new growths after a hard, cold winter. The world comes back alive as the cold gives way to warmer rains, bringing life back to the world.

tasks.longDescription: The Rune of Spring encompasses new growths and new opportunities.                                  The Rune of Greed expands on the feeling of gathering all the new bounties Spring brings, lest a cold snap takes them away again.

The Daffomil will act like, well, a giant fan, and blow items away from it. You can aim a Daffomil much like you can a Mana Spreader : Sneak + Right click it, then Sneak + Right Click where you want it to blow towards.
With enough Mana, the Clayconia will slowly transform Sand close to it into Clay.
The Hyacidus causes heavy amounts of mental pain to all creatures, mimicing a Poison. The Poison will not kill the creature, only hurt it badly. It will not Poison you or your assistants.
The Solegnolia is specifically for certain Mana Accessories that attract items, disabling their effect.
The Agricarnation infuses the land with Mana, increasing the speed in which crops grow. It can be controlled with a Redstone Signal.
The Jaded Amaranthus will most likely be one of your best friends, as it will grow more Mystic Flowers with enough Mana.

quests.name: The World Next Door
quests.description: Through careful study and some mystical hints scattered through some of the magic of these flowers and constructions, we've discovered there is a world right next to yours, just sliiightly out of alignment. Another race of creatures used to live in your current world, but do not any longer. I think we can contact them with the power of Botania magic! I've written down how to make all the items you'll need in the Lexica Botania. I don't think you'll have enough power to send much once you construct and open the gate, but....wait, throw your Lexica Botania in first, then a block of Living Wood to show that you've learned some of their knowledge!

tasks.longDescription: We've recently added some interesting things to your Lexica Botania. On pages like the Alfheim Portal, you can have it display the multiblock in the world so you know where to place items! Also, don't forget, to keep the portal open requires a constant stream of Mana!

quests.name: Power and Elegance
quests.description: We've tested a few things with the Alchemy Catalyst and have discovered a few extra things, like creating a rough dirt that grass will not grow on, and is great for making special paths. Meanwhile, we've also been advancing research of infusing items with Mana. We decided to see if we could create a sort of Focus. It will draw energies from the earth to power up many of your advanced Botanical creations. If you put it near an Enchanting table, it'll increase the power of the Enchants you can imbue, for example. Its quite useful when you don't want to have a giant box of bookcases around the little enchanting table...But speaking of Enchanting, we had a visit from one of the Thaumaturgic research lab to discuss some similarities between our Occult fields. With his help, we have been able to construct a sort of...ritual area using these Pylons, that enables us to  do some advanced Enchanting. I've written down all you need to know in your Lexica Botania.

tasks.longDescription: This has also become useful as a Ritual Focus in Thaumaturgic rituals.
You can toss regular Dirt into a Mana Pool augmented with an Alchemy Catalyst to get a coarser version, which can then be used to make these ornamental footpaths.

quests.name: Strength of Gaia
quests.description: These Gaia Spirits are...amazing. The material is unlike anything many of the other Occult branches have seen yet. We've begun careful research since it is very difficult to get a reasonable amount of of the material, but we've already created a few things you may be interested in.

tasks.longDescription: The top tier of Mana Spreaders, this is improved in every single way.

tasks.description: Take It, Put It Over Here
tasks.longDescription: Monster Spawners are quite fragile, you cannot remove them easily without breaking them. The Life Aggregator allows you to pick up a Spawner and place it down somewhere else. You can only do this once per Aggregator though.
When put on any tool that normally takes Damage with use, Timeless Ivy will instead allow the tool to consume Mana you are carrying in place of Damage, much like Mana and Terrasteel tools do.

BE VERY CAREFUL WITH THIS! When you use the Shard of Laputa on the ground at your feet, it will infuse a sphere around 14 meters radius with Mana, and then piece by piece raise it high into the sky. You cannot stop it once it starts! You can also increase the radius by a meter or two with each Gaia Spirit you combine with the Shard of Laputa.
This Rod, at the cost of lots of Mana, will constantly summon Arcane Missles that target enemies around you randomly.
Crafting this and using it in the Gaia summoning will summon an even stronger, deadlier Gaia. The risk, though, comes with great rewards if you succeed!

The Dice of Fate is a special reward to those brave enough to face the challenge of Gaia. The Elves say that the Gods play Dice with the Universe, and you can as well. By rolling the dice, you can get one of six different Relics. The legend says a person can only ever get one of each Relic.

Be careful with this. Using a Gaia Spirit to super charge some TNT is a dangerous, foolish endeavour, but...it looks so cool!                         You can only set the Manastorm Charge off with a Mana Burst. This will create a Manastorm Epicenter, which will fire Mana Bursts in all directions, which WILL EXPLODE when they hit something.

The Elves speak of something that is a combination of a Game and a source of Mana. By using Guardian Spirits to create a special Flower, and using logic and reasoning, you too can play it.            The Dandelifeon requires a 25x25 block area to function properly, with the Dandelifeon placed in the center.                        If you understand the rules to Conway's Game of Life, you'll understand a good portion of this....Game. You'll need some Cellular Blocks, made from Cactus, as well. Look in your Lexica Botania for more information.

quests.name: Charms of Gaia
quests.description: Gaia Spirits seem to eminate with quite a lot of power. I've given each of my assistants a few Spirits each to research, and with the help of the Elves, we've come up with some excellent Accessories you can make use of.

tasks.longDescription: Ever wanted to the fly? Make yourself a Flugel Tiara! It gives you short term flight when worn, which is quite useful.                        While flying, you can Dash in the direction you are facing by hitting the Run button. You can also Glide by Sneaking while flying or falling.
An improvement to the Soujourner Sash, Gaia Spirits give it a big speed boost!
While wearing this Charm, when you strike an enemy and have enough Mana, you will temporarily convert the enemy to your side to protect you.
This Crown will prevent you from dieing. Once, that is. If you are wearing this when you die, the Crown will break and you will still live.
A serious improvement to the Pyroclast Pendant, the Crimson Pendant will even allow you to stand in Lava with no problems.

These two Cloaks go into your Belt slot. They activate when you take damage, then take 10 seconds to recharge. The Cloak of Virtue will block all damage of a single strike, while the Cloak of Sin will damage all hostile enemies around you for the same amount of damage.

quests.name: Even Better Equipment
quests.description: Like Manasteel, you can forge the Terrasteel into various pieces of armor. Its much stronger than Manasteel, resembling the strong crystalline structure of Diamonds, without the brittleness. Like Manasteel armor, it will consume Mana from a tablet before taking damage itself. We then tried to make more tools with the Terrasteel, but unlike its Manasteel counterpart, only a few of these tools actually functioned well...and boy did they function! Two of these tools will be quite useful to you, as they'll help you carve your own place into that deserted world.

tasks.longDescription: Wearing all four pieces of Terrasteel armor will allow you to renegerate health even if you hunger bar isn't full, and your Mana tools will take 10% less Mana.

The Terra Shatterer is special. We've found we can feed it Mana by Charging it like any other Mana containing item, but you cannot take Mana out. Instead, as it holds more and more Mana, the more powerful it becomes. After you've charged it with some Mana, you'll have to activate it by Right Clicking.

Be careful with this! This tool is able to terraform large areas of land around you as you use it, though it takes a LOT of Mana. Unlike the Terra Shatterer, this destroys all the materials in the process!
This weapon is thrown with a Right Click, where it will pierce through enemies and possibly poison them. It can bounce off a few walls before returning to you like a boomerang.
By adding some Terrasteel to the Ring of Magnetization, you get a more powerful version that has a farther distance!

quests.name: Elven Upgrades
quests.description: These Elven materials are fantastic, and the Elves themselves are quite intrigued by what we've learned and discovered. With their help, we've come up with a handful of new and upgraded devices you can use.

tasks.longDescription: You can make an upgraded Mana Spreader with Dreamwood. It will fire more Mana Bursts, with more Mana, that last longer before they begin to lose Mana.

The Elves found the Open Crate...amusing. They also had an idea on how to make it more useful. You can pipe items into it in a specific order to automatically craft them. The Placeholder is for when an item has an "Empty" spot. Look at your upgraded Lexica Botania for more detailed instructions.
An upgraded version of the Abtruse Platform. It works just like it, except now everthing can pass through it.
An improved version of the Drum of the Wild. When a Mana Burst hits it, all sheep around it become sheared. If a bucket is under a Cow, it will be filled with Milk.
Making Brewing Vials with Alfglass instead of Managlass gives you a stronger, somewhat larger container. This results in more drinks per Brew!

This pedastal can be passed through by both creature and Mana Bursts. You can place a Mana Lens in it, and any Mana Burst that passes through it will change to that lens's type. You can turn it off by applying a Redstone Signal.
End Stone is mystrious in its own right, and a nice color. The Elves have shown us we can make some nice decorative designs with it as well.
The Resolute Ivy can be combined with any item. When you die, this item will appear with you when you respawn. The effect only lasts once per use.

You can upgrade the Terra Blade with some fairly useful abilities.                                        The first is called the Starcaller. Each swing has a chance of summoning a shooting star from the sky, which will fall onto the area you are aiming at. Any entity hit with it will take damage.

The second upgrade involves imbuing the Terra Blade with the power of the Storm.                         By sacrificing the long range attacks, instead you can cause a lightning attack to arc to multiple enemies. Each time the lightning arcs from one enemy to another, the damage it deals decreases.

quests.name: Elvish Devices
quests.description: The wonderful, magical properties of these Elven materials has really sparked the creativity of my assistants and I, and we've been working night and day to create new devices for you to play with. The Elves as well are quite creative, and have helped out in these designs.

tasks.longDescription: When colored with a Dye, Mana Spreaders equipped with this Lens can Paint blocks by shooting them with a Mana Burst. Only blocks like Wool, Carpet, etc can be painted.

This augments a Mana Pool like the Alchemist Catalyst, but allows you to double some materials at the cost of Mana. You can duplicate Redstone, Glowstone, Nether Quartz, Coal, Snowballs, Netherrack, Soul Sand, and Gravel just by throwing it into the Mana Pool.

Those Monster Spawners in your world only seem to create monsters if you or an assistant are close by. With this, you can make it spawn horrible deadly creatures at all times. Why? I don't know, but you might find some use out of it.

Overcast sky all the time? Too much light pollution? Even the Elves have this problem. They've come up with a solution called the Starfield Creator, which will cast a stary filled sky above you. Quite peaceful and beautiful!

Adding this to your Mana Blaster allows you to have six Mana Lenses on it instead of one. Shift + Right Click to change which slot you are on. When you add a Lens, it adds it to the slot you are currently on.
The World Seed will teleport you back to the World Spawn (where you first appeared) if you are over 24 meters away.

The Warp Lens changes a Burst so that if it hits a Force Relay, it will warp to the block the Relay is bound to, maintaining Momentum and Direction. Bore Lenses will not break Force Relays or Pistons.

This is an odd little item. I don't know if you'll have a use for it under normal circumstances. The Elves use it for various challenges and events they hold to test themselves.                                    This Cocoon, after being placed, will eventually 'grow' a baby animal inside of it. Usually it'll be a farm animal, but occasionally you'll get something like a baby wolf. The Elves say that you can entice it by using an Emerald on the Cocoon while its growing...

Slimeballs still contain a bit of the living essence of Slimes themselves. By encasing it in a magical jar of Alfglass and Elementium, it has enough life to it to react.                                       When holding the Slime in a Bottle and you enter an area where Slimes naturally spawn underground, the little bitty Slime will start bouncing around! Cute and helpful!
The Redirective Mana Lens can only be used in a Mana Spreader. When it fires a Burst, any other Mana Spreader it hits will turn to face the Spreader with this Lens.

These two Mana Lenses are more for display and fancy visuals than function.                                 The Celebratory Mana Lens causes the Burst to explode in fireworks when it hits something.          The Flare Mana Lens changes the Mana Burst into a Mana Stream, like a continuous sparkler or flare firework!

quests.name: The Best Equipment?
quests.description: Its only logical that after making Manasteel and Terrasteel equipment, that when given an even more powerful metal, we forge it into something useful, right? Well, Bandit, thats what we did! And these armor and tools all do something different!

tasks.longDescription: Each piece of Elementium armor you wear increases the chance that a Pixie will spawn when you get it. This Pixie will counterattack for you. When holding the Sword, the chance is increased, and the Pixies will hit harder as well. Also, if you are wearing all four pieces of Elementium Armor, your tools take 10% less Mana, and Pixies can give you random Potion effects.
The Elementium Pick will atomize Stone, Dirt, and other simple materials, leaving precious Ores behind.
The Elementium Axe is very good at decapitating enemies.
The Elementium Shovel will not only dig Sand or Gravel, but it will destroy it, and all like it connected to the same pile.
If you wield the Elementium Shears like a bow (Don't ask how we figured THIS one out...), all Sheep around you will automatically Sheer themselves.
The Extrapolated Bucket has a bottom....and it doesn't. All liquids you scoop into this Bucket will vanish, forever.
The Ring of Far Reach will extend your arm's reach by about three meters.
Like Elementium Armor, the Great Fairy Ring will increase the chance of a Fairy spawning when you get hit.
The Crystal Bow doesn't fire normal arrows: instead it creates them out of Mana and fires them faster than a normal bow.

The Black Hole Talisman is useful if you need to store a ton of a single thing on you, such as Cobblestone if you are deep in a mine. Right Click an empty Talisman on any block to set the Talisman to it. Then you can Shift + Right Click to activate the Talisman. You can keep grabbing as many of the item as you want, but the Talisman will make sure you keep only one stack of it in your inventory at all times. If you Right Click the Talisman on an inventory, it will dump its contents into it.
The Thorn Chakram can be upgraded to be a bit more powerful by imbuing it with some Pixie Dust and setting it on fire. It will then ignite any enemy it hits!

quests.name: Masterwork Magic Staves
quests.description: We revisited our research into Magic Staves and Rods since we now have access to new materials. Elvish materials give us a slew of new things to try, and we've come up with a few new toys for you!

tasks.longDescription: An upgraded Rod of the Lands, this one enables you to materialize dirt in midair! Good to save yourself from a fall. Unless you can fly, that is.

Freezing ice to make a path is good, but Elementium enables us to go one step further. The Rod of Bifrost creates a magical rainbow broad in the air and lasts 15 seconds, so move quickly!                  You can also enchant a piece of Alfglass by combining it with the Rod of Bifrost, to resemble the Rainbow Road, and this can further be turned into Bifrost Panes, or combined with other material to make Shimmerock and Shimmerwood! Shimmerrock can also be made into a fantastic, colorful new Mana Pool as well.                                         You do not lose the Rod making Bifrost Blocks, thankfully!
This Staff allows you to negate the gravity around a creature and pick them up. If you swing the Staff while carrying one, you will propel them away from you.

quests.name: Soft Spoken Teacher
quests.description: Pleasant talking to you, Bandit. I'm not sure of your rank in The Business, but right now, I'd like to consider myself your teacher, and you my student. I work off a mixture of both show and tell, that is to say, I'll explain something to you, and then you either send me or show me your work. As you show me your growing skills in what I have to show you, the more I will teach you and the more I will reward you.

quests.name: Decorate and Collect
quests.description: As time goes on, I'm noticing you collect a whole lot of Cobblestone. Massive amounts, really. You have to mine and dig out all your supplies, and to get to them without advanced machinery, you have to carve yourself tunnels and paths and whatnot. That cobblestone takes up a whole lotta space, yeah? Not to mention just how much Dirt is around you as well, and other common materials...Lets find some uses for all of them! We can make nicer looking materials out of those, for sure. And...how about we compress some of it down for better storage? We could probably find a use if you compress Cobblestone down far enough...Oh, and send me samples of everything please? This lab is kind of drab and...well, it WAS a tiny office, not a laboratory. Now it's kind of both.

tasks.longDescription: You can compress down some common materials for better storage. Some can be compressed to quite unrealistic proportions!
There are a lot of blocks you can Paint with a Paintbrush, more than what I'm showing you here! You can also Sneak + Right Click the Paintbrush onto any of these blocks to copy the color of it.
There are multiple decorative things you can make with Gravel beyond just Road.
Beyond this you have a few more options on edging patterns for your stone constructions.

quests.name: Research - Shiny Material
quests.description: Your QUEST Tablet scanners show lots of wonderful, rare gems and metals in the ground. Could you send me some samples of the nice, really shiny, sparkly things? Please? I promise, it's for research!

quests.name: Research - Mystical Material
quests.description: I've gotten some intriguing information from some of the other branches of The Business, Bandit. Your world is infused with mystical energies of all kinds! I'd like you to send me various samples of the 'Magical' nature of your world...

tasks.longDescription: To make Burnt Quartz, simply cook a Block of Quartz in a furnace.

The Wither is a tough boss. You'll need 4 soulsand and 3 Wither Skeleton Skulls to summon it. I suggest summoning it in a safe area, as it will destroy everything around it while fighting. I won't take the Star, I just want a direct scan...

quests.name: Magical Energy Generation
quests.description: Because of the Pink Generator, I decided to start looking more into using more Magical materials for Power generation. I've definitely invented some quite amazing varieties for your use, and to boot I've gotten ideas for even bigger Generators! Give me some time, try these out first please.

tasks.longDescription: We eat Food to Fuel our bodies, right? Why not use Food to make Power as well? This Generator can do just that! The more filling and satiating a food is, the more power it will generate!
The basic Furnace Generator is good, but I felt that it wasted a lot of Heat...and Heat is nothing but Energy! This Generator slowly heats up, but as it does, it becomes more and more fuel efficient!

Alchemy is a bit of a new thing to me, though I have had a 'Pick Me Up' potion once before. It gave me the idea to convert the Magical energy in Potions into Power! The more 'steps' it takes to make a potion, the more Power it generates.

By using Lava, we can melt Redstone Dust into a molten state, useable in this Generator. You have to pipe in the Lava to be safe, but if you have another way to make Molten Redstone, you could skip the Lava.

Those Endermen have quite special eyes. Not only do they see so many things we cannot, they are brimming with Energy! This Generator can be powered with them in Pearl or Eye of Ender form, or in Ender Lily Seed form.

quests.name: Interesting Tools
quests.description: Examining the Magical nature of all your world's materials has lead to some interesting inventions on my part. Even your most basic of materials seems to have some very interesting properties! I'm pretty sure we can discover even more things to Invent at this rate. Maybe I can get a bigger office...I mean lab.

tasks.longDescription: I got new curtains yesterday for my house. Complete garbage. They were 'blackout' curtains but didn't block the light enough! So I made some with the Wool you sent me and...well, I got what I wanted. The curtains block ALL light from passing through it, as well as let you easily walk through them without letting light past.

Laboratory testing tends to generate a lot of trash. Failed experiments, broken equipment...well, I made a Trash Can out of some of your materials for the lab next door, and it worked well. REALLY well! Anything put into the trash can just...vanishes!

I love how Obsidian looks, and I wanted to see if I could find more use out of it other than as a Blast resistant material. Well, I call this an Angel Block, as I feel it can save your life. By merely placing it in front of you, even in empty air, it will stay there. You can do this under your feet if you start to fall, and it will stop you! Then just punch it once, and it pops right back into your pocket!

Things can get quite noisy here in The Business. Labs testing various devices, creating giant thunderstorms, causing accidental explosions...sometimes its hard to nap at your desk! Your Wool has amazing properties, and makes quite powerful noise cancellers!

quests.name: A Better Glass
quests.description: Glass itself is quite useful, yeah? Helps keep bugs out, lets us see out of our houses, and treated just right it can be be shatter resistant and as tough as metal. But, sometimes, we need it to be even tougher! And we can use the Magical properties of your materials to do this. I call it Thickened Glass. You can make a nice range of different varieties of the Thickened Glass as well, depending on what you combine it with. Some of the other labs have even started taking notice of what we are doing here!

tasks.longDescription: Just mix some regular Glass with some Sand to get the initial material. It looks kind of interesting on its own, don't you think?
Take the Sandy Glass and cook it up, like you would normal Glass. This is Thickened Glass, and it looks sleeker and better! It's ALSO a bit more blast resistant than normal glass!

I love how normal Thickened Glass looks, but we can do a whole lot more with the looks. Could you send me samples of each? I want to decorate the place, more labs are taking notice of what we are doing...I can think of a lot of designs you can make, but how about just sending me these two here?
When we start mixing other things into the Thickened Glass, we get quite interesting results! Some of it looks pretty, other pieces seem to emit light themselves! Again, send me some samples!
While normal Thickened Glass is more Blast Resistant, I wanted something even MORE resistant. To that, just add Obsidian!

I had a crazy idea after that Obsidian Glass. What if we add in...Blackout Curtains? I did, and well...you can see through the glass perfectly. Only light doesn't pass through it. Which should be impossible, right?

quests.name: Transfer Materials
quests.description: I've become enamored with one of the item piping systems one of the other research departments has been working on. An item of any size can be put into one of their tubes and it'll travel through it like water, and come out somewhere else. I liked it, but thought...we can do better than that. Thats what Inventology is all about! So, to start with, we need a way to put items 'into' a piping system. Thus, the Transfer Node. You put it on a chest or other piece of inventory, and it'll start collecting the top item in the box into it. Meanwhile, it will search through our network of pipes for somewhere else to put it. Since it'd be silly to fill a box with both water and machinery, I've made two different Nodes : Items and Liquids. Both can transfer along the same pipes though. Along with these, I have a big assortment of Pipes you can use, each useful in many different ways!

tasks.longDescription: For items to move around, you need to use Transfer Pipes. When node finds a junction with multiple paths, it will choose one randomly: if you want the item to keep going straight, use the Crossover Pipe at junctions.

tasks.description: Take It, Put It Over Here!
tasks.longDescription: Attatch these to an inventory you wish to pull items from. It will grab the first item into its buffer, and search the pipe network its connected to, randomly choosing a direction when it hits a fork in the road, until it finds an inventory to drop the item in, or a dead end, then starts again.

Sometimes, you only want to put a certain amount of an item in an inventory, like if you were trying to evenly distribute Coal into some Generators. The Rationing Pipe will only put up to a full stack of material in an inventory, while a Hyper-Rationing will only put a single of an item into it.

Each direction the Filter Pipe can go is a different color. You can set each color to filter out a different item, and ONLY that item will travel that direction. You can make an Item Filter and use it instead to filter out more than one item in a given direction.

Already have a storage system set up? Sorting Pipes can help augment it. They will only place items into an inventory that already contains the item. The Mod Sorting Pipe will only put items into the inventory that match the Mod of any item in said inventory.

quests.name: Powerful Transfers
quests.description: Transfer Nodes are great and all, but I began to wonder...can we do even more than this? Pipes are pretty simple in concept, so can't really have them do more than we already do...but I think with the power of the QDS we can reverse the power of a Transfer Node and have it RETRIEVE items from the Pipe Network! We can also transfer items and liquids around all day, but one thing we're missing? Energy transfer. Our compact piping system is missing a way of transfering energy along pipes as well!

tasks.longDescription: Transfer Nodes work by sending the item through the network. Retrieval Nodes are the opposite : they will scan the network until it finds an inventory with a valid item, and will then grab it. Item Filters and most other Upgrades work on Retrieval Nodes as well.

Energy Transfer Nodes accept Redstone Flux (RF), Minecraft Joules (MJ), and Electric Units (EU) and convert it to RF, but can't convert power back to EU. Energy Transfer Nodes can accept some upgrades like Transfer and Retrieval Nodes can.
Energy Transfer Nodes only transfer energy along these pipes. Item and Liquid pipes will ignore these pipes.

This special pipe acts like an Energy Transfer Node, giving you the ability to use only a single Energy Transfer Node for an entire network. Any generator connected to this pipe can send Energy through the network.

We can pipe Power through our Pipe Networks now, and thats fantastic! But sometimes....sometimes you need power in an out of the way place, and running 'that' much Pipe is just not feasible, nor is setting up a brand new power generator setup for it. The QDS lets us create items imbued with the power of the Ender, and these upgrades take that to full advantage. You'll need a transmitter and a receiver, and to etch the same name into both on an Anvil. This name becomes their Frequency, and all Transmitter and Receivers with the same name are on the same Frequency. This way, you can transfer power wirelessly! Note, there IS a bit of energy loss...but stacking multiple Transmitters on a node will increase the power output to that Frequency.

quests.name: Bigger Tools
quests.description: So thanks to the QDS I've started to come up with even more powerful tools and devices for you to use. They should definitely be more helpful for you given both the dangerous nature of your world and the volume of materials we'll be wanting from you in time.

tasks.longDescription: Not only does this fancy looking Chandelier emit light farther than normal light sources, it also prevents mobs from spawning in a 16 block radius.
Like the Chandelier, this giant torch also emits brighter light, but it also prevents most mobs from spawning 64 blocks around it!

Lava is a fairly useful thing for you. It can be used to generate power, defend yourself, and make Obsidian, but its dangerous to Pump. This Pump can help, though. Place it right over the Lava and supplying it with Power, it will Pump out Lava and replace it with Cobblestone to create a growing safe area to stand!
This is an upgraded version of Magical Wood. Placing it near an Enchanting Table will boost its power much higher than just Magical Wood or a plain Bookshelf will!

The Ender Quarry is a very efficient mining machine. Supply it with power, place a chest next to it, and it will start to mine the area in front of it. It won't mine common material like stone or dirt, but it will mine anything like Ore, Gems, etc, and replace that material with Dirt, to prevent cave ins and stuff.

To determine the area an Ender Quarry mines, you can surround the area with normal Wooden Fences, or you can use one of these at each corner of a rectangle. You MUST define an area either way, then place the Ender Quarry down next to one corner.
These Golden Spikes will damage and kill creatures that walk on them, much like the Iron Spikes. They will also, however, drop Experience Orbs as well.
These Spikes are the most powerful of them! Not only will they kill the creature, they will give it a chance of dropping items that usually only drop when you slay the creature with your own hands.

quests.name: Magical Division?
quests.description: Well, thats odd. For the past day or so, your Tablet scanner has been, well...crashing oddly, when it scans various parts of the world. We sent a firmware update to fix the 'error dividing' issue we were getting, and all looks good. Now, though, the data shows an odd...item...it blocks scanning further, part of the firmware update to prevent it crashing. All we know is it has something to do with dividing, and is hidden somewhere in chests scattered within your world.

quests.name: Mathemagical
quests.description: This Division Sigil is...amazing. It appears it can bend reality just a bit, and only in your world, to do some amazing things...but only if you Activate it first. Take the Sigil to an Enchanting Table, and it will reveal how to do an Activation Ritual with the Division Sigil. From there, I bet we can do a whooole lot of inventing. Math is the cornerstone of science, and with this, just how much fun can we have? Yeah, I thought so!

tasks.longDescription: The QUEST Tablet cannot show the item below, but it's there. Use the Activated Division Sigil to divide a Gold Nugget by Diamond to make a Semi-Stable Nugget. You COULD make an entire Ingot by dividing an Iron Ingot instead, but...uh....that division is VERY unstable and WILL EXPLODE in 10 seconds. Its safer to use a Gold Nugget...
Unstable Matter seems to be troublesome for the QUEST Tablet to display properly....This is what happens when you Divide things by Diamond instead of something logical(or even Imaginary...)
Unstable Ingots do not stack, but Unstable Blocks do.

quests.name: Replicating Your Core
quests.description: The core of your world seems to be made of Bedrock. In our world, Bedrock is tough, but nowhere as tough as your world's version of Bedrock. With some Compressed Cobble and some Unstable material, I think we can make a fairly close recreation of your Bedrock. We'll call it Bedrockium.

tasks.longDescription: Careful, Bedrockium weighs a whole lot! I'm amazed my backpack didn't instantly gain a new hole in it...and the ground underneath...

quests.name: Ethereal Tools
quests.description: This Unstable material is very power and very versatile. I've used it, combined with some obsidian to make it safe to hold, to make some of the standard tools we use around The Business. Each one seems to have quite a unique property related to the type of tool it is. They all, though, seem to not wear down at all. We still can't seem to get the QUEST Tablet to display most things we make with Unstable material...

tasks.longDescription: This pickaxe cuts through stone like butter and does not wear down, but nor does it drop any blocks.
When you hit a creature with this axe, it will take health from you and give it to the creature. Unless it is undead, then it will deal quad damage to it.

Like the Destruction Pickaxe, this will carve through anything soft as dirt, and will destroy any sand or gravel up above the block you destroy so you don't get buried, but it will also not drop any of these materials.
This hoe reverses time on some blocks. It will rewind time on crops you use it on, which isn't helpful, but it will also turn dirt into grass and cobblestone into stone.
These Shears work like normal Shears, but can also carve through any material thats as strong as Stone. Sneak + Right Click the Shears on the material to slice it cleanly.

quests.name: Ethereal Weapon
quests.description: Tools made of Unstable material have amazing, helpful properties, I have to say. We've made a sword the same way, and...we weren't sure of its properties yet until an assistant was trying to combine it with other items and accidently cut himself. Only he didn't. He gave a cry of pain and dropped the sword, along with a whispy ball of...sorta like smoke, but he wasn't bleeding or anything. After making sure he was okay, we checked the sword and this new item carefully. It..kind of reminded us of him, actually. We couldn't make heads or tails of it, so visited other research departments. The Thaumaturgic Crafting wing shed some light on us, as it was much like their magical aspects...except ours apparently was a piece of a Soul directly. They said he might be a little bit weaker as a result and to be careful. To be fair, we all agreed to do the same thing once, so now we have a small pile of soul fragments to research with. So far we've only found one thing we can make with it...

tasks.longDescription: This Sword is as sharp and strong as Diamond.

You gain a Soul Fragment each time you craft just the Etheric Sword in your crafting grid. The cost, though, is a heart from your lifebar. Permanently. You cannot go below three hearts, though, so don't worry.
The normal Watering Can is super helpful, but strangely fragile. We cannot hook it up to a machine to automatically water things without it just imploding. By adding a Soul Fragment, though, we can.

quests.name: The Glass Curtain
quests.description: These Unstable Ingots you can create with an Activated Division Sigil are amazing! I've tried it in various applications and come up with some really neat things. Take this glass : I infused it with an Unstable Ingot and got a nice, fancy glass that you can walk through, but monsters and animals cannot! I've even created a version similar to the Dark Glass at the request of some of the Occult wings of The Business. Conversely, I've also come up with something that will stay the same brightness at all times, perfect for movie studios needing a Green Screen!

tasks.longDescription: This Glass can be passed through by you and you assistants, but no creature can pass through it.
A clearer version of Ethereal Glass.
No light can pass through this version of Ethereal Glass.
No matter the light level or angle viewed, Lapis Caelestis blocks always show the same exact bright color, good for Greenscreen effects.

quests.name: Simply Handy
quests.description: The QUEST Tablet scanner shows you have a wide variety of materials you can use to build items and structures with, Bandit. But as its mostly just you working on things, you have to make everything by hand yourself, not to mention collect all the materials as well! This leaves you with perhaps a lack of both the nicer looking materials and the time to make everything by hand. It also leaves you a bit...shorthanded, when it comes to making things a bit more intricate like computer chips and logic processors...and given the 'apparent' magicalness of your world, I think we can exploit it. These three machines should help you out a whole lot. The Painting Machine lets you 'paint' the design of one block onto a cheaper piece of material. The Slice n' Splice should enable you to hook some of the simpler electronic components to a Zombie Head, using it as a sort of logic processor. This you can use to make the Crafter, which will help you automatically create items, taking out the monotonous process of crafting a single item over and over again.

tasks.longDescription: You can paint any of the following : Conduit Facades, Fences, Fence Gates, Stairs, Glowstone, and Slabs.
Along with the components to make any of these uh...'logic' processors... you'll need to supply some cutting implements. A pair of Shears and an iron Axe should suffice.
You can configure it to pull items, or push finished products, into a chest connected to it.

quests.name: The Second Tier
quests.description: I feel you've shown your growing expertise quite well. All the various materials you've provided us with for examination have proved excellent, as well as quite useful in examining your world. The inclusion of Glowstone in some materials has us looking into other materials unique to your world, including those intriguing Endermen and the, strange for me to be saying seriously, walking undead Zombies and Skeletons.

quests.name: A Home Distillery
quests.description: The Stirling Generator is a fantastic little power generator, but thats exactly what it is...little. It's also fairly inefficient, given the scope of things I am going to be showing you. But before we can get to those bigger, better things, we need to discuss Fuel. Solid combustables like coal are good in a sense, but we need something more concentrated, with much different properties. Specifically, we need liquid fuels now. With some water and some various ingredients to distill and ferment, we can make a small variety of Liquid Fuels. Distilling sugar and wheat or apples or seeds, will get you some very basic Hootch, which you can use instead of water to distill and concentrate more things into Fuel: Redstone and Gunpowder would get you the equivilant of Rocket Fuel, while Redstone and the fiery Blaze Powder would get you Fire Water. One other thing you can distill and ferment is Nutrient Distillation, which is made with water and a variety of once-living materials or mushrooms. Please send us one bucket worth of each so we can do more research with them.

tasks.longDescription: This Reservoir is good for holding and generating Water. You need to make a 2x2x1 structure of Reservoires for the tank to form. As long as two buckets worth of water are in it, it will generate another bucket every second.
Used mostly in place of Water to distill more powerful Fuels, this can also be used as a Fuel itself.
Burns faster and hotter than Hootch, it generates about four times more power.
While this doesn't generate much more power than Rocket Fuel, it does so at a slower rate.

quests.name: A Few New Tools
quests.description: Since we are beginning to work with much more advanced machinery, we will require better tools. The Yeta Wrench is similar to many other wrenches, and can work in place of those for other research department's machines when needed, but the Electrical Steel ours is made of gives it a special function with various bits of machinery and miscellanious items I'll be showing you later. Given that we will be needing more materials for the bigger machines soon, we also have a tool for your SAG Mill called the Dark Steel Grinding Ball. Aside from these, we have some newer tools my assistants and I have come up with. They aren't much, but...well, you'll see.

tasks.longDescription: A major function for you is the ability for the Yeta Wrench to safely help pick up machines without breaking them. Just Sneak + Right Click the wrench on an Ender IO machine and it will quickly secure it for storage and transport.
Instead of Flint, you can form Dark Steel into a ball and place it into the SAG Mill. It will both last longer and have better chance of finding extra materials.

This allows you to 'deposit' your experience in liquid form into a Fluid Tank or other liquid vessel if you Sneak + Right Click. You can retrieve experience by just Right Clicking it on the container.

These buffers enable you to create a 'transfer point' between different power or item transport systems. The Item can hold 9 items, while the Energy can hold 100k RF. You can combine them into an Omni Buffer as well that does both.

quests.name: Magical Machines
quests.description: By what my assistants have shown and taught me, my earlier questioning of whether Magic really exists in your world or not is answered: it does, and apparently in spades. We've examined the Enchanting Table you are able to make with your world's materials, and we've determined its a bit too...random...for our liking. While I had my assistants researching deeper into this inherent magic, I've drawn up some blueprints using materials used in the construction of the original Enchanting Table, but fused with my (and now your) knowledge of sturdy, dependable machinery. What we've come up with is simply called an Enchanter, and it will let you Enchant a Book and Quill, instead of a tool or piece of armor. Meanwhile, while researching these Zombies, we've found that even their heads can remain animated in strange ways. The assistants and I have come up with a way to keep the animated head powered with Nutrient Distilliation, around which we construct a shell of Fused Quartz and Dark Steel. We can then attatch any kind of Sword to Joe, as we've come to name him, and as long as he's fed Nutrients, he will hit nearby creatures with the sword.

tasks.longDescription: Instead of the random nature, by using a specific item as a catalyst and expending some of your Experience, you can Enchant the book with specific attributes.
Any magical Enchantments on the Sword used by Killer Joe will take effect, but no experience will drop.

quests.name: The Third Tier
quests.description: You have definitely surpassed my expectations! All the components you have sent, along with all the designs you have replicated properly, have really shown you have the knowledge and penache for this field, Bandit. Now, though, I was only going to show you the final tier of machinery I knew of, and teach you about Conduits, but...I believe it is time for both of us to embark on a new journey....research. The new materials from your Nether intrigue us a bit, but your Endermen intrigue us even more! Especially their ability to teleport! If we can harness this power for an inventory logistics system...the entirety of The Business could benefit!

quests.name: Highest Grade Components
quests.description: With the research speeding along well on the unique properties of Ender Pearls, and the Alloys we have made from them, we can go one step higher than our previous tier of components! Before now, Double-Layer Capacitors were one of the best we could make, without using extremely rare, unique materials that is. By encasing Glowstone in Double-Layer Capacitors bound with Vibrant Alloy, we can make quite powerful Octadic Capacitors. Now, we know the power of crystalline structures. It is what gives Fused Quartz such strength, after all. Crystals, gems, all have a lot of uses in an engineering setting, but even more so it seems when you begin to involve Magic in some sort. We can encompass the scope of Technology and Magic by coating gemstones with some of our Alloys or working them in the Soul Binder.. A diamond can be coated with small pieces of Pulsating Iron, and an Emerald can be coated with small pieces of Vibrant Alloy. A Villager Soul can then be bound to an Emerald, or an Enderman soul to a Vibrant Crystal. The resulting Crystals will be perfect for the new set of machines and tools I have ideas for. If you could send only one of each of these to us, please, we have plenty in the works that should help both of us.

tasks.description: Least It Isn't In a Suit
tasks.longDescription: These work wonders as upgrades in all the machines, and allow us to make even greater machines!

quests.name: Gotta Catch Em Souls
quests.description: In researching some of the new materials we have discovered in our lab, one of the assistants stumbled upon an...interesting tool. With the talk of Souls and Magic and all that, he got the idea to make a small container of glass, or in this case Fused Quartz, and put a 'magical' lid on it, similar to how a few of the more occult research branches jar their components. Well, his little test jar didn't seem to do anything until he went to fill it with some milk (fresh from the cow, for some reason...) to use in an experiment with The Vat, and instead the entire cow vanished. The vial was suddenly full of a glowy, wispy material, which turned out to be the cow, because when he uncorked it and upended the jar onto the ground, the cow popped back out immediately. Quite intriguing, so I beleive we shall call this unique find a Soul Vial.

tasks.longDescription: With a little knowledge sharing from one of the more esoteric Occult branches, we've developed a machine that'll let you manipulate certain...well, souls... that you collect.
You can use the Soul Binder to return a captured Zombie soul into one of our Undead Logic processors.

quests.name: The Final Tier
quests.description: So now we are in quite undiscovered country. With your help, we've expanded the variety of machines and tools we use to produce and keep inventory sorted and stocked. With the new components, we've opened up new possibilities, though. This is a new area of research for us, so let us see what interesting things we can create.

quests.name: Dark Tools
quests.description: Dark Steel is quite a useful metal, extremely strong and durable. And since you are creating it with materials from your current world, it has a bit of magical properties to it. By shaping the metal into tools or Armor, you can get the same protection as basic Iron, but more durable like the crystalline structure of Diamond. You can then take each Dark Steel piece to an Anvil and imbue it with an item (remember the 'magical' properties I mentioned?). Inspect each piece closely and it you will be able to tell what you can imbue it with. The QUEST Tablet seems to have some issues displaying these Dark Steel items though...

tasks.longDescription: The Ender is excellent at beheading certain enemies, as well as quite effective at damaging Endermen.
This Anvil lasts a lot longer than a normal Iron one does.

quests.name: Powered Up
quests.description: After researching both the Ender infused Crystals we've created, and the inherent magicalness of your tools, we've found a perfect way to power up your Dark Steel tools by placing a Vibrant Crystal into them on an Anvil to Empower them. They gain the ability to hold RF Energy like a battery. This will not only make the tool at the level of Diamond, as long as they are powered they gain extra abilities. Make four Vibrant Crystals while I explain what some of the special Powered properties are.

tasks.longDescription: Striking an Enderman with an Empowered Ender will disable its ability to teleport for a short bit.

If you are crouching when you cut the base of a tree with the Dark Axe, up to around 50 meters of Wooden Logs will break and fall down as well, as long as they were all touching each other. The Dark Pickaxe, while powered, will mine much faster.

quests.name: The Arteries of Logistics
quests.description: Now that you know how to make certain materials and certain machines, it seems a good a time as any to teach you how the blood flows in the Input, Output system of an inventory logistics system. By which, I mean Conduits! With them, you can pipe not only liquids like water, but Energy as well! Your Yeta Wrench is an invaluable tool when working with Conduits. They can go along floors, up and down walls, and can be tucked away in plain sight. We make and run quite a variety of Conduits: Redstone Conduits to send signals, Energy Conduits to transfer power, Fluid Conduits to move liquids around, and Gas Conduits to pipe strong gasses. And with some of the things my assistants are researching, I wonder if we can resurrect a somewhat old school technology for a brand new age...

tasks.longDescription: Redstone Conduit transmits Redstone Signals that pass through them. Insulated Redstone Conduit allows you to run multiple Conduits side by side, and control which side of the Conduit transmits the signal.
Similar to a Lever, the Conduit Switch allows you to turn on and off a Signal to a Redstone Conduit network.
A single bundle of Conduits can hold one of each kind of Conduit. To view only ONE type, hold your Yeta Wrench and Sneak + Mouse Wheel to scan through the Conduit types.
Gravity effects how fast fluids can flow through these Conduits.
This is a specialized Conduit for moving around Mekanism gasses.
You can hide bundles of Conduits by making Conduit Facades and painting them in the Painting Machine. When you hold your Yeta Wrench, all Facades will become invisible.

You can scan your Conduit networks for how much power is transmitting through part of it, or how much a specific Machine is taking. It can also copy Connection settings of some conduits by holding Sneak and using your Mousewheel to select the setting, and then Sneak + Right Clicking to copy a connection's settings. Right clicking on another connection will paste the settings to it.

quests.name: Enderic Transfering
quests.description: All these various conduits that use the power of the Endermen's teleportation ability has sparked quite an idea amongst our lab. We can teleport fluids and items along a line of Conduits...why can we not do away with the Conduits themselves? We're already teleporting things, the Conduits merely provide a given path between Point A and Point B. So, to this end, we have constructed a machine. By assigning a designation to it, we can then assign the SAME designation to a second one of these Transceiver machines, and any items, fluids, or power we pipe through our Conduits into it will transfer between the two. The parts are fairly time consuming and expensive for a pair of these, but worth every pretty coin's worth. You can even make a specialized Rail in your Soul Binder and place it on a Dimensional Transceiver to teleport a minecart between two Tranceivrs.

tasks.longDescription: You must place this on top of a Dimensional Traceiver. You can then set the destination in the Tranceiver. Sneak + Right Click to change its direction.

quests.name: Endearing Conduits
quests.description: We have been doing lots of testing and research with these new alloys we all have come up with. The Ender infused alloys we've made have really pushed our IO sysem forward. Since a big use of our Conduits is Fluid and Energy pumping, I figured that we should see if we can improve on our design a bit. I believe we can utilize the teleportation properties of our Ender infused alloys. With these improved Energy Conduits, you can pipe massive amounts of Energy along them and the Fluid Conduits directly teleport Fluids to their destination, allowing you to pipe multiple fluids on the same Conduit. Both of these should keep your Conduit networks nice and compact. We've also been working closely with another branch of The Ferret Business to come up with new Conduits, resulting in two new ones that would interface nicely with their system.

tasks.longDescription: These two cables can be used to run ME cabling alongside your Conduits, making sure all your designs are nice and compact.

quests.name: A Pipe for Product
quests.description: One of the early systems we used to use in The Business, before networked computers and the like came along, was pressurized tube system, in which pill-like containers were shunted along the network of pipes. It was usually used for inter-office communication, sending reports to the central office, shipping tiny parcels around. This severely limited its use, especially when phones and better communication methods came along, and the tubes were quickly taken down and shelved. With these Ender alloys, we have dusted off the old blueprints and designs (the tubes themselves had long ago been repurposed for animal habitat decoration), and created an amazing Conduit. By lining tubes made of Pulsating alloy bound with Conduit Binder, you create a Conduit that uses the teleportative powers of Ender to transfer items of any size and shape along an Item Conduit network.

tasks.longDescription: When connected to an inventory, you can right click the connection to configure it, add upgrades, and more.

quests.name: Input, Output, Ender
quests.description: I believe we've found our penultimate tool, the device that will define our Research Lab for years to come. I present to you the EnderIO. By encasing an Eye of Ender with Electrical Steel and Fused Quartz, we can access it with either a Staff of Travel or by standing on a Travel Anchor. When we do, our vision is shifted to the Anchor, seeing in a 7 square meter radius around it. Not only that, but we can remotely interact with everything in this vision area. We can pull levers, open chests and take items out or put items in, interact in any way with placed items. This opens up so many possibilities for The Ferret Business, both good and bad. To that end, you are able to limit who can access your EnderIO, whether you lock it to yourself, or setting a password on it. Along with the EnderIO, we have also created another useful device called the Travel Anchor, which you can interface with or without a Staff of Traveling. Just by standing on a Travel Anchor, you can see all other Travel Anchors around you, look towards one, and Jump to it. If you are holding up your Staff of Traveling, you can see them no matter what you are standing on.

tasks.longDescription: You can also insert the Travel Anchor into a Painting Machine to decorate it as another block.

quests.name: Fitting Fixtures
quests.description: Primarily if we aren't dealing with the logistics of sorting items, we're dealing with Powering, Lighting, and whatnot various rooms. Power is something we'll cover some other time, but right now I can show you a few things that are generally quite helpful. The first is a Fluid tank, which when constructed using your somewhat magical materials, becomes able to hold liquid of any temperature, though not a whole lot. There are also a pair of lights you can make, each one useful depending on how big an area you need to light.

tasks.longDescription: Normally requiring a Redstone Signal to turn on, you can affix a Redstone Torch to this to invert the effect.
Works like the normal Light, but requires Power as well as a Redstone Signal, and will cover a larger area.

quests.name: Improved Fixtures
quests.description: With the new materials we've created in the Alloy Smelter, we can improve on an older design, as well as show you some new designs that should be quite useful around a workshop. By utilizing Dark Steel and Fused Quartz instead of Iron and Glass, these devices fully utilize the properties of both.

tasks.longDescription: Not only does this improved Fluid Tank hold twice as much, its also fairly blast resistant. Good for when handling unstable materials!
This special Obsidian is HIGHLY resistant to certain types of efffects: more specifically, the destructived nature of the strange monster your QUEST Tablet calls The Wither.
The Quartz Frame can be placed into a Painting Machine to customize the look, and then placed on many of the special types of Quartz Glass I've shown you how to make.

A normal Pressure Plate will send a Redstone Signal when anything lands on it. The Dark Steel Pressure Plate will only send one if you or one of your assistants stands on it. It can also be painted in a Painting Machine, and if you paint it with Quite Clear Glass, it will be more or less invisible!
You move up and down this faster than normal ladders.

quests.name: Powerful Machines
quests.description: These new Crystals have quite a wide variety of uses. We've dug out some of our old blueprints we don't use anymore to help give us some ideas, and we've come up with a handful of new machines for your use that utilize just a bit of the immense potential of these Crystals.

tasks.longDescription: This Chest will draw in any dropped items close to it and store them if it has room.
Supplying this machine with power and tools and it can automatically till, plant, and harvest both plants and trees.

Something I noticed from the initial data from your world are these...strange contraptions, from which monsters spring out. Deeper scans of these things have shown them to be somewhat unstable, and removing it will most likely break it...but I think we can take this broken contraption and combine it with this new Powered Spawner on an Anvil to create a new, working one.

quests.name: Backpacks
quests.description: Any adventurer worth his salt will end up with more things than he can carry in his pockets in the middle of a trip. And then it becomes a matter of "Do I leave the priceless gemstone the size of my head, or the priceless statue made of silver?" Why not take both, I say! You can craft yourself a sturdy backpack with some leather, letting you carry all those goodies! You can even craft a nice fold out crafting table right onto the bag!

tasks.longDescription: You can also dye any Backpack with one of the 16 colors.

You can put the bag on  your back by Sneaking and using your Backpack key (Default is B). This most likely won't work, as you need to rebind the key to something unused. While it is on your back, you can hit the Backpack key to open it!

quests.name: Morph
quests.description: Ever want to be a sheep? A bat? A zombie? Well, now you can! As part of the Assistant program of The Ferret Business, you agreed to having nanobots injected into you. One of their big functions right now is basically altering your form on the fly. After you've killed a creature to absorb their DNA, you can select and morph into them. Well, most forms, some things just don't mesh well with this technology...Anyways! Could you send me uh...lets say some clouds! Yeah! You'll have to calibrate the nanobots by going to the Nether, and kill a bat to get its DNA, but could you fly up and send me a few clouds?

tasks.longDescription: You can cycle through your collected Morphs with [ and ], and select one by hitting Enter.

quests.name: Natura
quests.description: Nature itself is a wonderful thing. For an adventurer, it provides not only sustenance, but things to find, things to fight, and things to make! To start off with, in your travels you'll probably find a few of these plants: barley and cotton. Go ahead and harvest them, they are quite common and they can be pretty useful!

tasks.longDescription: Barley acts much like wheat. You can craft it to turn it into flour and cook it in a Furnace to make bread. Cotton you can harvest to make string or cotton.

You can combine 9 of one type of seed into a bag, that will plant in a 3x3 area. You can do this with : (Wheat) Seeds, Barley, Cotton, Potato, Carrot, Netherwart, and even Bonemeal to apply it to a 3x3 area!
A bit harder to find, but invaluable in the desert. Sagura Cacti grow Fruits that can be eaten to satiate you, or planted in sand to grow another Sagura Cactus.

quests.name: Exploring Over the World
quests.description: Exploring more of the world you are on is a must! Not only can you find great things like ruins and dungeons and other things to delve into, you can also find a wide variety of rare natural materials to build with! Why is this important? Well, you need a place to KEEP all your discovered loot, right? Well, you can easily make it out of Stone and Oak and whatnot, but there are so many other trees out there you can use. There are also a lot more out there naturally to help sustain yourself with! Adventuring is a hungry job!

tasks.longDescription: You can find Berry Bushes all over the place! They give you a quick snack, not very filling, but quite saturating! You can break the bush down and plant it back at home, and it'll grow upwards. You can also combine a few piles of berries into a bowl and make a much more nourishing meal out of them!

All these trees can give you a nice variety of different colored woods, and these woods can be used to make many of your normal wooden implements in their respective colors! Theres lots out there, but you only need to show me a few of them.

This isn't the LARGEST tree I've seen before, but that one is super rare....this one is just as good though! Unlike most Saplings, the Redwood Sapling requires you to plant a 7x7 area with the sapplings and just wait. A long while. It's worth it!

quests.name: Netheral Tools
